column10: Select how the shooting area is displayed. When is set or an RF-S or EF-S lens is used
Select [: ISO speed settings] (). Set the desired minimum shutter speed.
Select [: HF anti-flicker shooting] (, ). Switch to the indicated shutter speed.
You can select the flash mode to suit your desired flash photography. With Speedlites having a zooming flash head, you can set the flash coverage. Select the settings to be cleared.
You can select how the camera determines subject brightness. Effective where there are much brighter lights around the subject due to backlight, etc.
Select [: Detect priority AE while AF] (, ).
For vivid blues and greens, and very sharp and crisp images. Effective for impressive landscapes.
Set toward the negative end to make images look softer or toward the positive end for a sharper appearance.
Select [: HDR shooting (PQ)] (, ).

With [] (Ambience priority), you can slightly increase the intensity of the image's warm color cast when shooting a tungsten-light scene. If you select [] (White priority), you can reduce the intensity of the image's warm color cast. A value can be set representing the white balance color temperature.
Set the white balance bracketing amount. Sample setting: B/A bias, ±3 levels
Select [: Dust Delete Data] (). File size is essentially unaffected by Dust Delete Data appended to images.

As you shoot multiple exposures (2–9), you can see how the images will be merged into a single image. Select [Select image for multi. expo.]. You can select a JPEG image shot at the same angle of view as the first selected JPEG.

Larger aperture values increase the focus shift and make focus bracketing cover a wider range under the same focus increment and number of shots. Depth compositing image quality setting and images saved

With the interval timer, you can set the shooting interval and number of shots, so that the camera takes individual shots repeatedly according to your interval until your specified number of shots are taken. Set the shooting interval and number of shots. Can be set in a range of [00:00:01]–[99:59:59].

You can choose the method of shutter release. Shooting activates the mechanical shutter. Recommended when shooting with the aperture of a bright lens wide open. Recommended when shooting with the aperture of a bright lens wide open.
Select [: Release shutter without card] ().
Select [: IS (Image Stabilizer) mode] ().
Select [: OVF sim. view assist] ().
Select [: HDR/C.Log View Assist.] (, ).
Set the lens's focus mode switch to .
The camera focuses in a narrower area than 1-point AF. The camera focuses using a single AF point []. When Servo AF is used, first you will focus using an AF point [].
Set the lens's focus mode switch to . Select [: MF peaking settings] (, ).

Select [: Register people priority] (, ). JPEG or HEIF images can be used. Process any RAW images you will use into JPEGs or HEIFs before saving them to the card. Display when registered faces are detected
Select [: Change mov rotate info] ().
Next, select the last image (end point). A checkmark [] will be appended to all the images within the range between first and last images. Turn the dial to select a rating mark, then select [OK].
Select [: Protect when setting the rating] (). Select the rating levels to protect.

Select and specify the images individually. Press to print a copy of the displayed image. By turning the dial, you can set a print quantity of up to 99 copies. Press to add a checkmark [] to the box. The image will be included in the index print.

Select [: RAW image processing] (). JPEG or HEIF images at the specified aspect ratio are created when you process RAW images shot with [: Cropping/aspect ratio] () set to [1:1 (aspect ratio)], [4:3 (aspect ratio)], or [16:9 (aspect ratio)]. You can adjust the image brightness up to ±1 stop in 1/3-stop increments.
Turn the dial to resize the cropping frame size. The smaller the cropping frame, the more magnified the cropped image will look. Check the image area to be cropped.
Specify the images to be played back.
Read the message displayed, then select [OK]. For movies, searches apply to files in the XFVC or CRM folder.
Select [: View from last seen] ().
You can magnify display of your captured images. Magnified view starts from the center of the screen.
[] (little blurring/lack of focus) is displayed for images that are fairly clear and in focus when viewed with the naked eye at actual size.
Add a checkmark [] next to the number of screens to display.
Select [: Movie play count] ().
Select to name sets of settings. Use the virtual keyboard () to enter text. Change, delete, or check the settings as needed. Change, delete, or check the settings as needed.
For secure FTP transfer using a root certificate, import a root certificate (). Select [: Transfer images to FTP server] (). If you have selected [Login password], enter the name and password.

You can use the camera to transfer images to a computer (). You can specify the format of images to transfer to a computer (). For RAW+JPEG or RAW+HEIF images, you can specify which image to transfer.
Use the app to scan the QR code. You can select the type of movies uploaded. You can select the type of still photos uploaded.
First, set up the camera to use as a sender. Select [: Sync time between cameras] (). Set up cameras to use as receivers.
In [Size to send], you can select the size of images to send.
Set up the camera for remote shooting.
Select items to check or change. You can change the TCP/IPv4 settings. You can change the TCP/IPv6 settings.
Select [: GPS device settings] (). Update the GP-E2 firmware to Ver. 2.0.0 or later. Select [: GPS device settings] ().
Audio output is LPCM/16bit/2CH (channels 1 and 2), even with [: Audio format] set to [LPCM/24bit/4CH]. Select if you will use an iOS app.
Select [: Record func+card/folder sel.] (). Set the recording method for still photos. Records still photos to the card selected in [ Record/play].

Captured still photos saved in a folder are assigned a file number from 0001 to 9999. You can change how the image files are numbered. File numbering is reset to 0001 if you replace a card, create a folder, or switch the target card (as in →). This is useful if you want to organize images by cards or folders.

Recorded movies saved in a folder are assigned a clip number from 001 to 999. You can change how clips are numbered. Clip numbering is reset to 001 if you replace a card or switch the target card (as in →). This is useful if you want to organize movies by cards.
You can set how movie files (clips) are named. A 3-digit number from 001 to 999 preceded by C, as in C001–C999. After C999, D is used at the beginning.
Select [: Add rotate info] ().

You can specify to use the screen or viewfinder for display, to avoid accidentally activating the viewfinder sensor when the screen is open. Always use the screen for display when it is open. Use the screen for display when it is closed and facing you, and switch to the viewfinder when you look through it.
You can magnify menu screens by double-tapping with two fingers. Double-tap again to restore the original display size.
Select [: Cooling fan settings] ().

You can set whether to leave the shutter open or close it when the camera's power switch is set to . Select [: Shutter at shutdown] (). Leaves the shutter open. This keeps camera quieter when the power switch is set to or . Useful when you want to shoot quietly.
Always use a fully charged battery.
Reenter the password, then select [OK].

Customized controls when shooting (still photo shooting)

level3: RF lens MF focus ring sensitivity

column10: With [: AF area] set to [Whole area AF], the camera focuses in the area near the pointer. Choose [Orange], [Purple], or [White] as the pointer color. Choose [] or [] as the style of pointer displayed.

level3: AE lock meter. mode after focus

column10: With [: Main rec. format] set to [RAW] () Mainly for cinematic purposes. (23.98 fps) is available when [: System frequency] is set to [59.94Hz:NTSC]. Test cards by recording a few movies to make sure they can record correctly at your specified size ().
You can specify the format of movie files recorded. Select [: Main rec. format] (). XF-HEVC S can be used to record 10-bit YCC 4:2:2 signals.

level4: XF-AVC S YCC420 8bit XF-AVC S YCC422 10bit
XF-HEVC S YCC422 10bit XF-HEVC S YCC420 10bit

column10: With RF or EF lenses, you can record movies cropped around the center of the image area, as if captured with a telephoto lens.
Select [: Dual shooting (still&movie)] ().
You can choose the audio format used for sound in movie recording.
Select [: HF anti-flicker shooting] (, ). Switch to the indicated shutter speed.
Select [: Detect priority AE while AF] (, ).

Available when the [Gamma/Color Space] gamma is set to [HLG] and color space is [BT.2020] Sets the center frequency for edge enhancement Settings to correct image areas with certain color characteristics

level4: Color Matrix Tuning Fine-tuning of image color tones

column10: For vivid blues and greens, and very sharp and crisp images. Effective for impressive landscapes.
Set toward the negative end to make images look softer or toward the positive end for a sharper appearance.
Select [: HDR shooting (PQ)] (, ).
This setting is available when [: HDR shooting (PQ)] is set to [HDR PQ].

With [] (Ambience priority), you can slightly increase the intensity of the image's warm color cast when shooting a tungsten-light scene. If you select [] (White priority), you can reduce the intensity of the image's warm color cast. A value can be set representing the white balance color temperature.
Set the white balance bracketing amount. Sample setting: B/A bias, ±3 levels

With [Main rec. format] set to [XF-HEVC S YCC422 10bit] With [Main rec. format] set to [XF-AVC S YCC422 10bit] or [XF-AVC S YCC420 8bit] Indicates the time required to shoot the set number of shots with the set interval. If it exceeds 24 hours, “*** days” will be displayed.
The tally lamp lights up or blinks to indicate camera status.
Select [: IS (Image Stabilizer) mode] (). Select [: IS (Image Stabilizer) mode] (). Camera shake will be corrected. The image will be slightly magnified.
You can clear (delete) metadata registered to the camera. You can review details of the metadata registered to the camera.
To set up the time code, use [: Time code]. You can set the initial time of the time code. Time codes can be added to movies as you record them to an external device via HDMI.
Select [: HDR/C.Log View Assist.] (, ).
Select [: False color set.] ().
To simplify exposure adjustment before or during Movie Recording,<i name=camera"/>Camera
column11: you can display a striped pattern over or around image areas of a specified brightness."

column10: Select [: Shooting info. disp.] (). Select [: Shooting info. disp.] (). Select [: Shooting info. disp.] ().
Select [: Quick Ctrl screen] ().
Select [: VF display format] (, ).
Select [: Reverse display] (, ).
